text: "Diggy Liggy Lo" is a single by American country music duo Rusty & Doug. The song was written and originally performed by Terry J. Clement. Released in 1961, their version peaked at number 14 on the Billboard Hot Country Singles chart. Doug Kershaw, one half of the duo, released a solo version of the song in 1969 that peaked at number 70 on the Billboard Hot Country Singles chart. It also reached number 1 on the RPM Country Tracks chart in Canada. ==Chart performance== ===Rusty & Doug=== {|class="wikitable" !align="left"|Chart (1961) !align="center"|Peak position |- |align="left"|U.S. Billboard Hot Country Singles |align="center"|14 |} ===Doug Kershaw=== {|class="wikitable" !align="left"|Chart (1969) !align="center"|Peak position |- |align="left"|U.S. Billboard Hot Country Singles |align="center"|70 |- |align="left"|Canadian RPM Country Tracks |align="center"|1 |} ==Cover versions== *Buck Owens, On the Bandstand (1963) *Nitty Gritty Dirt Band, All the Good Times (1972) *Commander Cody and His Lost Planet Airmen, Hot Licks, Cold Steel & Truckers Favorites (1972) *Teddy Nelson on his debut album, Diggy Liggy, in 1976, and again as a duet with Skeeter Davis in 1991 for the album You Were Made for Me. *Kikki Danielsson, Kikki (1982) *Mark O'Connor, Heroes (1993) *Santiano (2012) *Plava Trava Zaborava, a country group from Croatia. *Cumulus, a Finnish version. ==References== Category:1961 singles Category:1969 singles Category:Rusty and Doug songs Category:Doug Kershaw songs Category:RPM Country Tracks number-one singles Category:Song recordings produced by Buddy Killen Category:Songs written by J.
